snippet: Fundamental conditions drive election outcomes. But in this odd campaign, the fundamentals conflict. Once familiar political signals are muffled. That makes predictions hazy — still.
abstract: Political Memo; fundamental conditions usually drive election outcomes, but current midterm election cycle is confusing because many fundamentals conflict and once familiar political signals are muffled; political analysts say it is harder to make objective predictions of landscape due to rising number of voters interpreting economic developments through prism of political arguments.
lead_paragraph: Fundamental conditions drive election outcomes. But in this odd campaign, the fundamentals conflict. Once familiar political signals are muffled. That makes predictions hazy — still.

headline.main: In a Partisan Atmosphere, It Can Even Be Hard to Find Numbers That Agree
headline.print_headline: In a Partisan Atmosphere, It Can Even Be Hard to Find Numbers That Agree
